column4: is it worth trying to setup wine for office apps, or should i just do a kvm install of xp and install office there?
plus, I have several statistics packages that can only work on excel
can you provide a link to a howto?
noice
I don't want to spend any more money than I already have for an office app
2007 at student discount is still fairly expensive
the problem is that ati initializes the sound infrastructure first, which causes the onboard realtek card to not work.
the ATI hdmi driver grabs audio in a weird way
you can specify (in alsa) a different default audio device
ati wouldn't make the realtek card 'not work'
you can, by changing alsa configuration, or you can just disable the ATI driver.  like i said, he needs to google for details
it does
you apparently haven't looked at the ATI HDMI driver and how it works
this is a known, documented issue
no i haven't seen the source, but I have the same setup: ati gfx card and realtek onboard
weird, then I guess my system is an exception
only happens on machines that have an ATI HDMI audio driver (not all ATI cards expose this, the machine I'm currently on does not)
my hd card does
it does
it's a driver, not a codec
good luck. If it's anything to do with a sound daemon on top of alsa, I haven't the foggiest
